author: Mia Perkovic

text: Now can you post the Japanese romaji
author: VGBC P3rs0na

text: I'm not sure about the first one, but I think it's "hikaiorou", his attacking quote is "てうちにいたす" (teuchi ni itasu) and his leaving quote is "さらばだ" (sarabada). I forgot to mention that he also sometimes says "kaeru" and "hebi" when transforming into a frog or a snake. "kaeru" means frog and "hebi" means snake.

text: There are even more connections than that. The game engine for Link's Awakening evolved from this - hence the similar overworld and sidescrolling elements. In addition it borrowed the game's font, and even many of the sound effects.

author: jackal27

text: I'll have to play this game eventually now that an english translation is available. I'm sure some of you recognize this theme. That's because this game is pretty much a precursor to Zelda: Link's Awakening. Richard has a cameo in LA, with a version of this theme playing. Just like LA, it has top view and side view gameplay (inside dungeons for example). The soundtrack by Totaka is extremely similar in style too. So yeah, I'm looking forward to it since LA is my favorite 2D Zelda.
author: SupraDarky
